column4: i have suspicions it might be the micro sd => sd card adapter
as i know other sd cards have worked with this
you may want to check the forums for that exact make laptop. Often theres some kernel options needed for  some special cases.
ive also seen some cases where the card Must be inserted at boot time. or else the system cant see/access it..  (which is annoying, but thats how my netbook is)
You are not plugging a 'sdhc' card into a normal 'sd' slot are you?   saw that issue once. :)
i'm plugging in a microsd hc card into a microsd to sd adapter
ive seen where a 'sdhc' (high capacity) card wont work on an older 'sd'  slot.   how big is the card?
be sure the slot says its a sdhc slot perhaps?  in system specs or printed on teh pc somewhere.
slot reader should support it according to The multi-card reader only supports SD and SDHC cards with Ubuntu 10.10.
i think its the fault of the adatper
could be.  I got a little  mini-usb adaptor i always use for my micro sd cards these days. i rarely use a microsd-sd adaptor
what do you mean mini-usb adaptor
its a litlte plug about the size of the end of your pinky. :) microsd plugs into it.. it has a usb plug on the other end.
I always use that usb adaptor for mine. it always works. :)
